title: Foster the People's 'Sacred Hearts Club' is a Fun Ride
summary: Foster the People's new album is reminiscent of classic rock bands like Pink Floyd and Led Zeppelin. Artists often write about the things they experienced in their youth, so it makes sense that your artistic career is shaped by your formative years. When you're writing songs, you’re likely to explore what you were experiencing during that time. It’s healthy for artists to push their own boundaries, and artists who want to experiment with new sounds should consider releasing their music independently – this will allow you to fully explore your creative vision.

This is especially true for artists who revisit the music of their youth. Many artists \u2013 including Foster the People \u2013 first got their start in garage bands in their teens.
If you\u2019re an artist seeking inspiration, it can be helpful to think back to your high school years. Foster the People\u2019s album is reminiscent of classic rock bands like Pink Floyd and Led Zeppelin. In fact, \u201CHustling\u201D features a saxophone solo that sounds eerily similar to Pink Floyd\u2019s \u201CMoney\u201D. It might seem like a stretch, but artists like Pink Floyd and the Beatles have always served as inspiration for musicians. You might not be the next Zeppelin or Floyd, but you can certainly be inspired by them.`),mdx("h2",null,"It helps you reconnect with your youth."),mdx("p",null,"When artists go back to their roots, they\u2019re often reconnecting with the musical vision they had as a teenager. When you\u2019re writing songs, you\u2019re likely to explore what you were experiencing during that time."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re an artist who wants to get back to your roots, start by exploring what was going on in your life during that time. Foster the People\u2019s album certainly reflects the band\u2019s youth. The LP\u2019s theme is tied to the California license plate \u201CSLOMO\u201D \u2013 a reference to the band\u2019s time spent in Los Angeles. It\u2019s possible that the band members were inspired by their experiences living in the city, which brings us back to the previous point."),mdx("h2",null,"Sometimes going back to the basics is exactly what you need."),mdx("p",null,"If you find yourself in a creative rut, consider taking a step back and simplifying your process. For example, make a list of your favorite artists in the world, and ask yourself why you\u2019re a fan. This can help you engage with your core audience."),mdx("p",null,"Foster the People's list of influences for this album include Pink Floyd and Weezer. The best way to get back to the basics is to focus on your craft and come up with a bunch of killer songs."),mdx("p",null,"If you want to get back to the basics but aren\u2019t sure where to start, try writing lyrics without the music. You can then take these emotions and use them to create music."),mdx("h2",null,"It\u2019s healthy for artists to push their own boundaries."),mdx("p",null,`When artists go back to their roots, they\u2019re often looking to push their boundaries. We\u2019re all familiar with the saying, \u201CIf you do what you\u2019ve always done, you\u2019ll get what you\u2019ve always gotten.\u201D But in this case, it might be exactly what you need.
When Foster the People released their debut album in 2011, the music was very accessible. The album was heavy on pop, alternative and dance sounds. The band\u2019s new album, \u2018Sacred Hearts Club\u2019, is much more experimental. Tracks like \u201CPay the Man\u201D are multi-layered and heavy on psychedelic sounds.`),mdx("p",null,"When artists push their own boundaries, there\u2019s a good chance listeners will respond. The best way to put this into practice is to start listening to music that inspired your favourite artists, but also look at the artists who were inspired by those artists.
This is a cyclical process that can help you get inspired and create something new. Foster the People has done just that. Take the track \u201CLoyal Like Sid and Nancy\u201D and the track \u201CFireflies\u201D by Owl City.
